DOC.brief_title: Outcomes Of Perioperative Pregabalin On Total Knee Arthroplasty
DOC.detailed_description: Aims : Whether pregabalin give preoperatively one week postoperatively addition patient-controlled analgesia ( PCA ) morphine effective reducing morphine requirement , improve pain score reduce chronic neuropathic pain compare placebo primary total knee arthroplasty . Methodology : A single-centre double-blind randomize controlled trial patient undergo primary total knee arthroplasty . All subject receive PCA morphine , paracetamol 1g every six hour , etoricoxib 120mg daily postoperatively . Subjects receive either pregabalin 75mg po preoperatively follow 75mg OM 25mg ON two day postoperatively match placebo . The primary outcome cumulative morphine consumption 72 hr follow surgery . Secondary outcome measure include pain score , knee range motion patient satisfaction .
